intro: Echinopsis tiegeliana, commonly known as the Tiegelen’s cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are covered in white, spiny areoles. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers during the warmer months. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. Echinopsis tiegeliana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
